intro: Staelia herzogii, commonly known as the Herzog's staelia, is a flowering plant native to the Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a dense, spherical shape. Staelia herzogii is often found in open, sunny areas and is considered a rare and endemic species.
